translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Short Passages to be Reflected Upon
The Elder Sumanā
“My name was Sumanā,
and at that time I was a garland maker.
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
who receives the world’s offerings.

analyzed: ubho hatthehi paggayha  sumanam puppham uttama
translated: With both hands I picked up🔽the supreme jasmine flower
and placed it on the Buddha,
Sikhī, the world’s protector.
Because of this flower offering,
and because of my intention and aspiration,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the result of my worship of the Buddha.
In the twenty-ninth eon from now,
the flower I placed on the Buddha,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the result of my worship of the Buddha.
In the twenty-sixth eon,
there were four of great fame,
who had the seven treasures,
wheel-turning monarchs.
The four analytical knowledges …
… and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus have I heard: this was said by the Elder Sumanā.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sumano thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Sumanattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sumanaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽sumana therassa apadānam navama
translated: The Elder Sumanā’s Birth Story is the ninth.
